titles.title: A resolution to amend the Standing Rules of the Senate to provide that no tax increase may be enacted except with the approval of two-thirds of the Senators present and voting.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Rules.

bill.summary: 7/31/1987--Introduced. Amends rule XVI of the Standing Rules of the Senate to prohibit any bill, joint resolution, conference report, amendment, or other matter providing for a tax increase from being enacted except by two-thirds vote of Senators present and voting.
